page.title: 05INDUSTRY
page.content: There is no industry in this area now but from the 18th century onwards there was a thriving coal-mining industry on Clee Hill. Coal was first mined in bell-pits at Crumps Brook from about 1760.There are still mounds showing where the pits were in the area known as Lubberland. Later on shafts were sunk to reach lower layers of coal in the Whatsill and Magpie area, as more coal was needed for melting iron. As the demand for Clee Hill coal became less and pits were exhausted, coal-mining on Clee Hill ceased before 1940. The men went to work in the mine at Highley until that closed in 1970. The slag heaps which were left have now been covered over with grass and other plants making mounds on the hill.
